moves.1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 c6 3. c3 f5: Strange move order. A Dutch player probably won't play c6 so early, but it's ok.
moves.5. e3 Nf6 6. h3 Nbd7 7. Nbd2 Qb6 8. Qc2: Or Qb3, inviting the exchange. Boring game.
moves.8... Ne4 9. Be2: Desperately looking for "something" to warm up the game. I think in sac f2.
moves.9... Be7 10. h4 Ndf6 11. Ne5 O-O 12. Ndf: I just don't want to castle kinside. That will kill the game.
moves.12... Ng4: ...but in hangering here and there, I got myself in serious trouble.
moves.13... Qd8: ? Misses the chance, or just want to delay it.
moves.14. O-O-O: I'll sac the exchange and a pawn in order to get some activity.
moves.14... Nxg3: Black chooses this way to cash in the exchange.
moves.15. fxg3 Nxe3 16. Qd2 Nxd1 17. Kxd1: I needed my Q on dark squares, to support g5.
moves.17... c5: Black seizes his chance correctly. But defence will be silly and boring. I prefer to risk...
moves.18... Qb6: ?Black should have exchanged, but that meant to open the h column... as I supposed, he thought it twice.
moves.19. Bh5: Not exactly knowing what to do, I try to provoke some weakness.
moves.19... cxd4: Black doesn't take the bait. Very good.
moves.20. Bf7+: Again, I didn't intend to defend. I have to attack to the death. I am pressing on e6, now.
moves.20... Kh8 21. Re1: I sensed this rook would have been fine, here, x-ray pressing e6. Even at the cost of...
moves.21... dxc3 22. Qxc3: ...and nothing happens. Now, a diagonal threat to open if g6. But...
moves.23. Qc4: Pressing e6. I'll tie black up. I'm -4, now!
moves.23... Qxb2: Maximum tension: the question is if black has something after Qb1+, or not. Ke2 (or Bb4+), d3+, Kf1, d2. But white has its own threats, too, and they will materialize very soon, and DON'T have a free tempo to the mate.
moves.24. Bxe6: f7 is free for my knight. And the famous pattern becomes now possible.
moves.24... Bxe6 25. Qxe6: Black has the move and the check... will ever he escape?
moves.26. hxg5: Simply this. The threat is the same.
moves.26... Rac8: ?? This makes the following sequence a piece of cake for white, but black though he was winning!
moves.27. Nf7+: Before, RxN and it would have been all. But now, such a move will be mate.
moves.27... Kg8 28. Nh6+ Kh8 29. Qg8+: It's always a pleasure when you can play this OTB...
